channel.title: A few questions for advanced coders
channel.description:
[size=15pt]A few questions for advanced coders...[/size]
1: Attacking Error l) OK, when I use a melee weapon and attack a player, it hits them. Then when they walk away, my character doesn't follow them and they still get damaged. My character doesn't move, and still they get damaged even if they are far away. Does anyone know how to solve this?
ll) [b]Sometimes[/b] when I click to attack somebody, it does the hitting emote but the other player doesn't get hit at all. I have to wait a few seconds then click on them again for it to attack properly. Why is this?
2: [s]Mage[/s]/Range NPC How do I make an NPC attack with [s]mage or[/s] range instead of melee?
3: Anti-lag I assume that you've heard of [b]ZdiddyScape[/b]? Around a month ago, there was a poll on which server was the best. ZdiddyScape was ranked [b]1[/b]. That server, and all the other popular servers are lag-proof. Whenever I [b]mass click[/b] on training objects, such as dummies, on their server, it doesn't lag. My server lags when I do hat. The ZdiddyScape owner said that there is no anti-lag code. He told me to just base my training on NPCs. A few people told me to add timers - but I already have actionTimer in the object case. Others said they saw a tutorial on how to make it lag-proof, but they won't give me the link. Just want to ask if there is a code that makes it anti-lag, and what the link to the tutorial is.

item.title: A few questions for advanced coders
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

Hmm, his source doesn’t have a boolean process? If I delete it, where am I supposed to add all the stuff in the process then?

Read full topic
item.source: A few questions for advanced coders

item.title: A few questions for advanced coders
item.dc:creator: @pmgz pmgz
item.description:
@pmgz wrote:

no nirvana its not usage of timers. I know that caused I helped zdiddy with it. If you notice his source doesn’t have a boolean process. Thats half of it, also to make a npc mage you have to make the animation or gfx attacking with mage.

Read full topic

item.title: A few questions for advanced coders
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

[quote=“pizza pie, post:4, topic:115203”]are you going to try to figure it out urself? attacking error can be fixed by the same way npc’s are fixed, for number two, you shud mess around with the timers, for number three, you would have to create your own code, or change the player code so that npcs can use, for number four, find the anti-lag code, fix your dam actionTimer, and make training npc based

that took me 2 mins, i think you shud freakin answer your own question, its not that hard, play around with your .java files!![/quote]

This is very useful information.

Read full topic

item.title: A few questions for advanced coders
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

[size=15pt]A few questions for advanced coders…[/size]

1: Attacking Error
l) OK, when I use a melee weapon and attack a player, it hits them. Then when they walk away, my character doesn’t follow them and they still get damaged. My character doesn’t move, and still they get damaged even if they are far away. Does anyone know how to solve this?

ll) Sometimes when I click to attack somebody, it does the hitting emote but the other player doesn’t get hit at all. I have to wait a few seconds then click on them again for it to attack properly. Why is this?

2: Mage/Range NPC
How do I make an NPC attack with mage or range instead of melee?

3: Anti-lag
I assume that you’ve heard of ZdiddyScape? Around a month ago, there was a poll on which server was the best. ZdiddyScape was ranked 1. That server, and all the other popular servers are lag-proof. Whenever I mass click on training objects, such as dummies, on their server, it doesn’t lag. My server lags when I do hat. The ZdiddyScape owner said that there is no anti-lag code. He told me to just base my training on NPCs. A few people told me to add timers - but I already have actionTimer in the object case. Others said they saw a tutorial on how to make it lag-proof, but they won’t give me the link. Just want to ask if there is a code that makes it anti-lag, and what the link to the tutorial is.
